Name: MARTIN Duesterbeck

Birthplace: HABERDORF, GERMANY

1. INTRODUCTORY QUESTIONS
What year did you start homesteading in Northern Canada? 1897
Where did you meet up homesteading? Dewey, Bessarabia, Russia
Where had you been living before that? Russia
How many people did you propose besides? 14
How far was it to your nearest store? 14 miles
How often could a visit be made to the store? Once every few weeks
What provisions did you usually buy in those earliest years?
Flour, sugar, coffee

2. FLOUR AND OTHER GRAIN PRODUCTS
What brand of white flour did you use in the early years? 4 X flour
In what quantities did you buy it? 300 lbs
What was the usual price per hundred pounds of white flour? $1.50
How much did you use Graham flour?
Whole wheat flour?
Was flour milled locally? Yes
How far away was it? What year?
What was the price for a twenty pound bag of rolled oats?
What other grain products did you use?
Cornmeal
Wheat Flour
Barley
Other:
Did you grind your own wheat for porridge? Yes
How did you grind it?
Dear Mr. Haberhauer,

I am writing to express my gratitude for your recent donation of $150 to our local charity. Your generosity has made a significant impact on our community, allowing us to provide much-needed assistance to those in need.

Thank you for your kindness and support. We look forward to working together again in the future.

Sincerely,

[Your Name]

12. WATER SUPPLY

How far was this water from your home? ...........................................

How was it brought to the house? (pail, barrel, tank) ...........................................

Regarding water supply, mention any changes which have taken place since you first started housekeeping, giving dates where possible.

In 1904 I had a well dug on my farm 24 ft deep.
I will buy my farm.

In 1906 I will buy my farm.

24 feet deep.
13. SOAP

Did you buy laundry soap or make your own? Made and own.

If you made your own, did you use lye? Yes, wood ashes?

What kinds of laundry soap did the grocer handle?

14. FUEL

What fuel did you use in the earliest days? David Monroe.

Where did you get your fuel? From the prairie.

Mention any changes in the use of fuels which have taken place since you first started housekeeping, giving dates where possible.

In 1902 started to burn some wood hauled by oxen from bush at Edenvold which was 1/2 mile from my farm. It was got by the polls and cut with a buck saw by hand.

What did you first see enamel ware? 1889, but never used it.

Aluminum?

Remarks of fireplace. We built it in the house with bricks made out of mud. We had a stove but couldn't use it on account of no wood for fuel.

Not much difference now just fancy new and more secure.

17. Give a typical day's menu (breakfast, dinner & supper) for the earliest year you can remember. Give the year and list the members of the family with their ages at the time. State the approximate month, e.g., winter or summer.

Breakfast: Coffee and bread.
Dinner: Water knepfla and slice of bread.
Supper: Coffee, maybe potatoes and bread.

18. What year did you serve your first Christmas dinner in Eastern Canada? .................. Give the menu. List those present and give their approximate ages at that time.

We always had bread to eat and some other little item to keep going.

Breakfast: Coffee and bread.

Dinner: White meatballs and chili beef.

Supper: Coffee, maybe potatoes and fried.

21. When did you begin to rely on purchased foods and prepared foods instead of homestead and home prepared foods? (Give as many details and dates as possible).

Always grew my own vegetables and raised my own meat until retired.
